com.microsoft.windowsazure.mobileservices.table.sync.localstore

Class SQLiteLocalStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • SQLiteOpenHelper
      • com.microsoft.windowsazure.mobileservices.table.sync.localstore.SQLiteLocalStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MobileServiceLocalStore

    public class SQLiteLocalStore
extends SQLiteOpenHelper
implements MobileServiceLocalStore
    Implements MobileServiceLocalStore backed by an SQLite DB

    • Constructor Detail

      • SQLiteLocalStore

        public SQLiteLocalStore(Context context,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        CursorFactory factory,
                        int version)
        Constructor for SQLiteLocalStore
        Parameters:
        context - context to use to open or create the database
        name - name of the database file, or null for an in-memory database
        factory - factory to use for creating cursor objects, or null for the default
        version - version number of the database (starting at 1); if the database is older, onUpgrade will be used to upgrade the database; if the database is newer, onDowngrade will be used to downgrade the database

      • SQLiteLocalStore

        public SQLiteLocalStore(Context context,
                        java.lang.String name,
                        CursorFactory factory,
                        int version,
                        DatabaseErrorHandler errorHandler)
        Constructor for SQLiteLocalStore
        Parameters:
        context - context to use to open or create the database
        name - name of the database file, or null for an in-memory database
        factory - factory to use for creating cursor objects, or null for the default
        version - version number of the database (starting at 1); if the database is older, onUpgrade will be used to upgrade the database; if the database is newer, onDowngrade will be used to downgrade the database
        errorHandler - the DatabaseErrorHandler to be used when sqlite reports database corruption, or null to use the default error handler.
